revised_title: Seismicity and Structure of the Zagros (Iran): Main Recent Fault between 33 and 35°N
tldr: This study examines the seismicity and structure of the Zagros mountain range in Iran, focusing on the Main Recent Fault between latitudes 33 and 35°N. The research investigates the relation between seismic activity and the most recent tectonic deformation along the fault, providing insights into the ongoing right-lateral strike-slip deformation and its implications for the seismotectonics of the Zagros.
